intro: Pedicularis japonica var. maximowiczii, commonly known as the Japanese lousewort, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of East Asia. It belongs to the family Orobanchaceae, which includes many parasitic and hemiparasitic species. The plant is characterized by its spurred flowers, which are typically pink or purple in color, and its hairy, glandular leaves. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in forested areas. This variant is distinguished by its slightly different floral morphology compared to the typical form of Pedicularis japonica.
